intro: Elatostema machaerophyllum, commonly known as the broadleaf elatostema, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants commonly known as nettles. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema machaerophyllum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in local ecosystems.
